title: FOIA - Shared Mailboxes (email) (Department Of Public Safety, Georgia State Patrol)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: FOIA - Shared Mailboxes (email) (Department Of Public Safety, Georgia State Patrol)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A CSV export of your agency's Shared Mailboxes (see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/email/about-shared-mailboxes?view=o365-worldwide for more info ) including the following parameters for every shared mailbox:

- Primary SMTP Address
- Date Created

A simple way to retrieve this is by having a member of IT (such as a System Administrator) run the following command in Exchange Online PowerShell (if email is hosted in a Microsoft Exchange environment):

Get-Mailbox -ResultSize Unlimited -RecipientTypeDetails SharedMailbox | Select Name,PrimarySmtpAddress,WhenCreated | Export-CSV -Path .\SharedMailboxes_$((Get-Date).ToString('MM-dd-yyyy_hh-mm-ss')).csv

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

communications.communication:
Good morning,


Thank you for your request to review County records.  On February 16, 2023, we received your Open Records Act request for the following documents or records:

A CSV export of your agency's Shared Mailboxes (see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/admin/email/about-shared-mailboxes?view=o365-worldwide for more info ) including the following parameters for every shared mailbox:
- Primary SMTP Address
- Date Created

After reviewing your request, it has been determined that The Department of Purchasing and Contracting is not the custodian of any documents responsive to your request.



It is possible that the County’s Department of Innovation and Technology may have the records you seek. You may contact John Matelski, 404-371-6210 or jmatelski@dekalbcountyga.gov.



The County and its officials and departments do not produce documents or records that are protected by the attorney-client privilege or the attorney work product doctrine under Georgia or federal law or that are otherwise exempt from production under the Georgia Open Records Act.  The County expressly reserves and does not waive any statutory exemptions from disclosure provided by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-72, et seq. and other applicable laws.


Sincerely,

ShaTausa Edwards

title: Policing of Attire at Columbus State University Student Recreation Center

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Policing of Attire at Columbus State University Student Recreation Center
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All responsive records as defined by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70(b)(2) related to the "CSU Student Recreation Center Dress Code" and related placards and posters placed throughout the Columbus State University Student Recreation Center, including but not limited to letters, e-mails, memoranda, notes, scientific studies, public health guidance, medical advice, and/or minutes of meetings, in written or electronic format.

All responsive records as defined by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70(b)(2), including but not limited to scientific studies, medical advice, and/or public health guidance relied upon by Columbus State University, that show shirts that have an armpit gap that is larger than the palm of the wearer's hand increase, contribute, or have any relation to the "transmission of viruses and infections"* in the development of the "CSU Student Recreation Center Dress Code".

All responsive records as defined by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70(b)(2), including but not limited to scientific studies, medical advice, and/or public health guidance relied upon by Columbus State University, that shorts that expose the buttocks increase, contribute, or have any relation to the "transmission of viruses and infections"* in the development of the "CSU Student Recreation Center Dress Code".

All responsive records as defined by O.C.G.A. § 50-18-70(b)(2), including but not limited to scientific studies, medical advice, and/or public health guidance relied upon by Columbus State University, that sports bras, shirts with a deep plunge, or "t-back" style shirts (all shown in the "What Not To Wear" section of the posters/placards) increase, contribute, or have any relation to the "transmission of viruses and infections"*, in the development of the "CSU Student Recreation Center Dress Code".

* As suggested by the "CSU Student Recreation Center Dress Code".

A photo of the "CSU Student Recreation Center Dress Code", as seen at the Columbus State University Student Recreation Center main desk, is attached.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hayden Barnes, Esq.

title: Coplink X New Orleans

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Coplink X New Orleans
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

According to public reporting, Coplink X has been beta tested by departments in Kansas City, New Orleans, Massachusetts and Oregon. I'm looking for documents pertaining to the department's usage the COPLINK or COPLINKX software from January 1, 2018 until the date this request is processed.

1. Invoices or receipts for the purchase of any the COPLINK or COPLINK X product/service
2. Communications, internal memos or directives that mention Coplink, Face Match, or FaceMatch
3. MOU's or Information Sharing Agreements about COPLINK or COPLINK X
4. Brochures or product/service specifications about COPLINK.
5. Privacy policies, manuals, briefings mentioning COPLINK or COPLINK X

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Your first record request #23-2918 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of New Orleans ************************************************************************ Your first City of New Orleans record request (request number #23-2918) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. Thank you, the City of New Orleans Law Department has received your Public Records Law request. Your request has been forwarded to the City department or office which is the custodian of the records you requested. The custodian will determine whether responsive records exist, and if so, compile the records for your review. Please refer to the due date located on the individual "Request #" page for an estimate of when your records, if any, will be available. This estimated due date may be adjusted depending on the nature of your request. Please be advised that each request should be limited to one subject. For example, a request for the tax history of three separate properties should be filed as a separate request for each property. If you include the three properties in one request, you will be asked to refile each property as a separate request. Note also that records may be in active use at this time and therefore not available for immediate review. Additionally, in accordance with the Louisiana Public Records Law, the City of New Orleans strives to promptly release all records which contain only public information and are not otherwise exempt from the Public Records Law. The City must balance its commitment to open access with its legal obligation to review public records for such exceptions and exemptions prior to release. Also, please be advised that there may be a delay in responding to requests for a compilation of email messages. Requests for a compilation of email is a complex multistep process. The request must first be sent to the City's IT Department to retrieve the requested emails. The City's IT Department performs a search of the City's email system utilizing search terms. The IT Department then forwards the results to the Law Department. The emails must then be carefully examined by the Law Department to determine if there is any material that must be redacted for privacy concerns and otherwise. As soon as the custodian notifies our office that the records have been compiled you will be invoiced by email. Once you pay the invoice, you may download the records. Alternatively, you may schedule a time to review or purchase copies of the records. Thank you for your request, and we look forward to working with you to provide public records in a fair and efficient manner. Thank you, Law Department City of New Orleans 1300 Perdido St., Ste. 5E03 New Orleans, LA 70112 (504) 658-9800 The due date for your request may be later than usual because the office is closed on: * February 20: Presidents' Day Request #23-2918. ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at City of New Orleans.

Technical support: See our help page

title: Case File 281A-NY-245-269

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Case File 281A-NY-245-269
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

The complete case file starting with the identifier 281A-NY-245-269 and all derivative material in the file. All contents of this file are of interest, and should be returned regardless of form number, format or serialization.

Upon information and belief, this file concerns an investigation and prosecution from approximately 1996 to 1998 (both years approximate and inclusive). Subjects of the investigation included members of the Genovese family of Cosa Nostra, leadership of law enforcement unions, and several vendors to the unions. 

Records should be released in the public interest which outweighs the privacy concerns. Additionally, there is no forseeable harm in release of the file, as the matters contained within are over 25 years old and either adjudicated or beyond the statute of limitations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

title: Records concerning deceased law enforcement union official

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Records concerning deceased law enforcement union official
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records naming or concerning the late Louis F. Matarazzo, Sr., onetime head of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association of the City of New York. His date of birth was 07/24/1939. He is reported deceased as of 2/12/2023. Attached find obituary as proof of death. 

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the ELSUR Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, and Counterdrug Information Indices System (CIIS), for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Trump Administration Death Squads (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Trump Administration Death Squads (Department of Justice, Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Seeking all records, including but not limited to emails, official documents and/or data related to the cost and/or discussion of firing squads, group executions, expansion of the death penalty and/or death sentences, hangings, or use of a guillotine from January 20, 2017 through January 20, 2021. 

These records may include, but are not necessarily limited to:

1. Any reports or budgets regarding the costs of implementing firing squads, group executions, expansion of the death penalty and/or death sentences, hangings, or use of a guillotine, including but not limited to Fiscal Impact Statements, budgets, expenditures or action plans.

2. Financial information, including costs, of contracts with third parties for the purpose of implementing firing squads, group executions, expansion of the death penalty and/or death sentences, hangings, or use of a guillotine, including but not limited to registration tools, web services, digital and social media advertisements, and enforcement authorities.

3. Cost of contracts with legal entities (including outside and in-house counsel) regarding counsel related to implementing firing squads, group executions, expansion of the death penalty and/or death sentences, hangings, or use of a guillotine.

4. Emails, text and online messages, letters, memos, policy papers, and any other communications regarding potential firing squads, group executions, expansion of the death penalty and/or death sentences, hangings, or use of a guillotine

5. Names, positions and salaries of full and part-time government employees tasked with estimating the cost of implementing firing squads, group executions, expansion of the death penalty and/or death sentences, hangings, or use of a guillotine.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Stephen Johnson

communications.subject: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Limits on Giles County Agri-Park events
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any Giles County Agri-Park bylaws, regulations, or rules.

2. Any agenda, minutes, audio recording, or video recording of any meeting of the Giles County Agri-Park Board Committee between July 1, 2022, and February 14, 2023.

3. Any records reflecting drafts, discussion, or deliberation over the Giles County Agri-Park bylaws or regulations by any member of the Agri-Park Board Committee. This request is limited to records generated on or after June 1, 2022.

4. Any emails, text messages, or social media messages sent to or from Graham Stowe or Matt Rubelsky which contain any of the following terms: "Pulaski Pride", "drag show", "impersonator", "impersonators", or "First Amendment". This request seeks records wherever they are stored or sent, including those stored or sent on private devices, networks, or systems. This request is limited to records generated on or after June 1, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Adam Steinbaugh.

title: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Sustained findings since 2017

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Sustained findings since 2017
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., I am requesting copies of records related to cases of sustained findings of police misconduct at the Baton Rouge Police Department’s Internal Affairs, between 2017 and 2022. 
My organization is specifically interested in a case index for any cases that meet the criteria of the last sentence. We previously submitted a similar request and in hopes of narrowing it down a bit, a case index would be extremely hepful.

Here, misconduct includes, but is not limited to:

Excessive (unreasonable) force – beatings, manhandling of people in handcuffs, improper use of Tasers, injuries inflicted by police dogs, improper use of deadly force, and other police brutality or disregard for the safety of suspects. It also includes, but is not limited to: physical and verbal abuse, restraints happening unreasonably, coerced or forced confessions, and sexual abuse and assault.

False arrests – pulling over, detention, questioning and searches conducted without any probable cause whatsoever, including cases of planted evidence, racial profiling and trumped-up charges of resisting arrest.

Louisiana's Public Records Act does not exclude police disciplinary records from release, even if it violates the officer’s constitutional right to privacy, as ruled by the Louisiana Court of Appeals in its 2008 case of City of Baton Rouge v. Capital City Press.

Any person who has been denied the right to inspect or copy a record under the provisions of this Chapter, either by a final determination of the custodian or by the passage of five days, exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays, and legal public holidays, from the date of his request without receiving a final determination in writing by the custodian, may institute proceedings for the issuance of a writ of mandamus, injunctive or declaratory relief, together with attorney's fees, costs and damages as provided for by this Section, in the district court for the parish in which the office of the custodian is located.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dilcia Mercedes

title: COTA Fare-Free Transit Analysis emails

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: COTA Fare-Free Transit Analysis emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. The email, sent on or about December 4, 2020, from an @icemiller.com email address, to COTA, addressed to Joanna Pinkerton, the subject of which is "Fare-Free Transit Analysis" or a variation thereof. I am asking for one specific email ("the report email"), not a broad category of records.
2. All attachments included with the report email when it was sent, to iclude cover letters, presentations, images, appendices, PDFs, Word documents, or other files that were included in the report email. This is not a request for a broad or ill-defined category of records, but a request for a specific set of files which are necessary to create a complete copy of a single record.
3. Any replies to the report email that were sent or received by COTA employees within the month after the report email was received. This includes emails in reply thanking the sender for the document, emails forwarding the document to other people "for your information", emails assessing whether this report is actionable, and any other email within the one-month time window that has a subject line or envelope metadata indicating that it was a reply or forward. The easiest way for you to find these emails, once you have located the original report email, is to search for the report email's subject field in other emails. This request is not for "all records containing particular words", "all records having to do with a particular topic", "all records of a particular type", "all emails sent or received by a particular email address with no subject or time limitation", "all documents which document any and all instances of a particular topic", or "discovery-style requests that seek all records relating to or reflecting certain types of information" as this request is limited by the type of record, date range, subject matter, chain of causation, and concerns only a specific report.

COTA's records retention schedule for all email is 7 years. The responsive emails are less than seven years old, and therefore should be retained by COTA.

If this information is insufficient to identify the responsive records, then pursuant to ORC 149.43(B)(2) I request information on the manner in which records are retained by COTA and its Office of the President and accessed in the ordinary course of the office's duties.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Benjamin Keith

communications.communication:
Gabriela VillegasN/AMuckRock News, DEPT MR140488263 Huntington AveBoston, Massachusetts 0211502/14/2023CBP-FO-2023-041548Dear Gabriela Villegas: This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 2/13/2023.  Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-FO-2023-041548 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a SecureRelease account. This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request.Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you.  Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c)CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience.  For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. Sincerely,U.S. Customs and Border Protection

title: Carson City Sheriff - Drone Program

communications.subject: Nevada Public Records Act Request: Carson City Sheriff - Drone Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nevada Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

-All policies and procedures for the operation of unmanned aerial systems (drones, UAVs)
-All flight logs from 2021-2022
-All complaints in writing from employees objecting to the use of UAS footage for training 2020-2022
-All written requests for UAS deployment 2021-2022
-All Part 107 certifications for agency UAS operators
-All FAA and Nevada Department of Public Safety UAS registrations

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tristen Taylor Werner

communications.communication:
Good morning,

Your faxed request was received on 02/13/23 at 2:37pm.  I entered your request into our PRR system this morning and will process it.

I will need additional time to gather the information requested beyond the five business days.  I will have a response to you on or before Thursday, February 23, 2023.
